creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
naming.factory.SendMailFactory.getObjectInstance contains an impossible cast from javax.mail.internet.MimeMessage to javax.mail.internet.MimePart

[Findbugs]

creator: craig.silk@gmail.com
text:
This cast appears to be legal because the class MimeMessage implements the interface MimePart.

Javadoc: http://java.sun.com/products/javamail/javadocs/javax/mail/internet/MimeMessage.html

I've checked the documentation as far back as is available and this seems to have always been the case.

Findbugs complains because the class MimeMessage does not implement MimePart, at least in the context of Tomcat.

This is because the local copy of the class does not implement MimePart, see:

http://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/tomcat/trunk/java/javax/mail/internet/MimeMessage.java

So I think it's still a bug, but the fault is in a different class.
creator: sebb@apache.org
markt@apache.org
text: I've updated the dummy impl to stop the false positive from find bugs.

The change fixes the complaint, however the class is still far removed from the actual API.

Would it not be better to use something like geronimo-javamail_1.4_spec-1.6.jar (e.g. from http://repo2.maven.org/maven2/org/apache/geronimo/specs/geronimo-javamail_1.4_spec/1.6/) so that the code is compiled against a more accurate spec?
creator: sebb@apache.org
